description: Adds a new table to an existing database in your account. In an Amazon Web Services account, table names must be at least unique within each Region if they are in the same database. You might have identical table names in the same Region if the tables are in separate databases. While creating the table, you must specify the table name, database name, and the retention properties. Service quotas apply. See code sample for details.

parameters.name: DatabaseName
parameters.description: The name of the Timestream database.

parameters.name: TableName
parameters.description: The name of the Timestream table.

parameters.name: RetentionProperties
parameters.description: The duration for which your time-series data must be stored in the memory store and the magnetic store. The duration for which data must be stored in the memory store. The duration for which data must be stored in the magnetic store.

nested_params.name: MemoryStoreRetentionPeriodInHours
nested_params.description: The duration for which data must be stored in the memory store.

nested_params.name: MagneticStoreRetentionPeriodInDays
nested_params.description: The duration for which data must be stored in the magnetic store.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of key-value pairs to label the table. (dict) --- A tag is a label that you assign to a Timestream database and/or table. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. With tags, you can categorize databases and/or tables, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment. The key of the tag. Tag keys are case sensitive. The value of the tag. Tag values are case-sensitive and can be null.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Tag keys are case sensitive.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Tag values are case-sensitive and can be null.

parameters.name: MagneticStoreWriteProperties
parameters.description: Contains properties to set on the table when enabling magnetic store writes. A flag to enable magnetic store writes. MagneticStoreRejectedDataLocation (dict) --- The location to write error reports for records rejected asynchronously during magnetic store writes. S3Configuration (dict) --- Configuration of an S3 location to write error reports for records rejected, asynchronously, during magnetic store writes. BucketName (string) --- The bucket name of the customer S3 bucket. ObjectKeyPrefix (string) --- The object key preview for the customer S3 location. EncryptionOption (string) --- The encryption option for the customer S3 location. Options are S3 server-side encryption with an S3 managed key or Amazon Web Services managed key. KmsKeyId (string) --- The KMS key ID for the customer S3 location when encrypting with an Amazon Web Services managed key.

nested_params.name: EnableMagneticStoreWrites
nested_params.description: A flag to enable magnetic store writes.

nested_params.name: MagneticStoreRejectedDataLocation
nested_params.description: The location to write error reports for records rejected asynchronously during magnetic store writes.

nested_params.name: S3Configuration
nested_params.description: Configuration of an S3 location to write error reports for records rejected, asynchronously, during magnetic store writes.

nested_params.name: BucketName
nested_params.description: The bucket name of the customer S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: ObjectKeyPrefix
nested_params.description: The object key preview for the customer S3 location.

nested_params.name: EncryptionOption
nested_params.description: The encryption option for the customer S3 location. Options are S3 server-side encryption with an S3 managed key or Amazon Web Services managed key.

nested_params.name: KmsKeyId
nested_params.description: The KMS key ID for the customer S3 location when encrypting with an Amazon Web Services managed key.

parameters.name: Schema
parameters.description: The schema of the table. CompositePartitionKey (list) --- A non-empty list of partition keys defining the attributes used to partition the table data. The order of the list determines the partition hierarchy. The name and type of each partition key as well as the partition key order cannot be changed after the table is created. However, the enforcement level of each partition key can be changed. (dict) --- An attribute used in partitioning data in a table. A dimension key partitions data using the values of the dimension specified by the dimension-name as partition key, while a measure key partitions data using measure names (values of the --measure_name' column). The type of the partition key. Options are DIMENSION (dimension key) and MEASURE (measure key). Name (string) --- The name of the attribute used for a dimension key. EnforcementInRecord (string) --- The level of enforcement for the specification of a dimension key in ingested records. Options are REQUIRED (dimension key must be specified) and OPTIONAL (dimension key does not have to be specified).

nested_params.name: CompositePartitionKey
nested_params.description: A non-empty list of partition keys defining the attributes used to partition the table data. The order of the list determines the partition hierarchy. The name and type of each partition key as well as the partition key order cannot be changed after the table is created. However, the enforcement level of each partition key can be changed.

nested_params.name: Type
nested_params.description: The type of the partition key. Options are DIMENSION (dimension key) and MEASURE (measure key).

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the attribute used for a dimension key.

nested_params.name: EnforcementInRecord
nested_params.description: The level of enforcement for the specification of a dimension key in ingested records. Options are REQUIRED (dimension key must be specified) and OPTIONAL (dimension key does not have to be specified).

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name that uniquely identifies this table.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of the Timestream table.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the Timestream database that contains this table.

nested_items.name: TableStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of the table:
DELETING - The table is being deleted.
ACTIVE - The table is ready for use.

nested_items.name: RetentionProperties
nested_items.description: The retention duration for the memory store and magnetic store.

nested_items.name: MemoryStoreRetentionPeriodInHours
nested_items.description: The duration for which data must be stored in the memory store.

nested_items.name: MagneticStoreRetentionPeriodInDays
nested_items.description: The duration for which data must be stored in the magnetic store.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time when the Timestream table was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The time when the Timestream table was last updated.

nested_items.name: MagneticStoreWriteProperties
nested_items.description: Contains properties to set on the table when enabling magnetic store writes.

nested_items.name: EnableMagneticStoreWrites
nested_items.description: A flag to enable magnetic store writes.

nested_items.name: MagneticStoreRejectedDataLocation
nested_items.description: The location to write error reports for records rejected asynchronously during magnetic store writes.

nested_items.name: S3Configuration
nested_items.description: Configuration of an S3 location to write error reports for records rejected, asynchronously, during magnetic store writes.

nested_items.description: The bucket name of the customer S3 bucket.

nested_items.description: The object key preview for the customer S3 location.

nested_items.name: EncryptionOption
nested_items.description: The encryption option for the customer S3 location. Options are S3 server-side encryption with an S3 managed key or Amazon Web Services managed key.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key ID for the customer S3 location when encrypting with an Amazon Web Services managed key.

nested_items.description: A non-empty list of partition keys defining the attributes used to partition the table data. The order of the list determines the partition hierarchy. The name and type of each partition key as well as the partition key order cannot be changed after the table is created. However, the enforcement level of each partition key can be changed.

nested_items.description: The type of the partition key. Options are DIMENSION (dimension key) and MEASURE (measure key).

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the attribute used for a dimension key.
